message.content:
cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.NI, cs.PL 

The paper deals with stabilization of a continuous-time, time-invariant, linear system over a digital communication channel, which involves concepts from control theory, information theory, and signal processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also discusses the transmission of information over a digital channel, which falls under the sub-category cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper proposes a novel encoding-decoding scheme, which involves machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category. The paper also involves the use of numerical simulations, which falls under the sub-category cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Finally, the paper discusses the implementation of the proposed scheme, which involves programming languages and software tools, making cs.PL (Programming Languages) a possible sub-category.
